use_cases_desc: Playing card games across individual and shared devices.
evaluation: User study (quantitative, controlled lab experiment); User study (qualitative); Deployment with users
contribution_desc: The paper presents two studies on cross-device interaction for games. It illustrates six different interaction techniques for cross-device card playing and evaluate their usability and usefulness. They conclude that "natural" gestures like a wrist-whip that mimicked the physical gesture you would use in playing cards was slower than the other techniques and that the participants found it less useful and less natural.
contribution: Study, deployment; Interaction techniques; Use-case, application
crossdevice_def: "Rekimoto (1998), for example, envisioned almost two decades ago what he called multiple-computer user interfaces and argued that interaction techniques must overcome the boundaries among devices in multi-device settings"
